title: Cat. 26.1  Portrait of Stéphane Mallarmé, 1891
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Portrait of Stéphane Mallarmé  
1891  
Etching, with drypoint and engraving, in black ink, with pen and black and brown ink, and brush and black and gray wash, on cream wove paper; 149 × 115 mm  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of the Gecht family, 2015.255  
Guérin 13, Kornfeld 12 I/IV  
For the verso, see fig. 26.1.1

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">William Molard (1862–1936), Paris.

D. David-Weill (1871–1952), Neuilly-sur-Seine, France.

Sold at Hôtel Drouot, Paris, to a private collector, May 1971.

Sold at Christie, Manson & Woods, Ltd., London, to Wolfgang Wittrock (born 1947), Berlin, Dec. 1982.

Sold by Wolfgang Wittrock to Francey (1922–2014) and Dr. Martin L. Gecht (1920–2005), Chicago, Aug. 1983.

Given by the Gecht family to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2014.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Washington, D.C., National Gallery of Art, The Art of Paul Gauguin, May 1–July 31, 1988, cat. 115 (ill.); Art Institute of Chicago, Sept. 17–Dec. 11, 1988; Paris, Galeries Nationales du Grand Palais, as Gauguin, Jan. 10–Apr. 20, 1989 (Paris only).

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Richard R. Brettell, Françoise Cachin, Claire Frèches-Thory, and Charles F. Stuckey, The Art of Paul Gauguin, with assistance from Peter Zegers, exh. cat. (National Gallery of Art, Washington, D.C./Art Institute of Chicago/New York Graphic Society Books, 1988), pp. 199–202, cat. 115 (ill.).

Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine E. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), pp. 40–41, cat. 12 (ill.).

Belinda Thomson, ed., Gauguin by Himself (Bulfinch, 1993), pp. 124, 305, fig. 88.

Nancy Mowll Mathews, Paul Gauguin: An Erotic Life (Yale University Press, 2001), p. 159, no. 50 (ill.).

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section other_documentation" id="other_documentation">Inscribed lower left, in graphite: W4772

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">There is a proof of the etching in a private collection dedicated to Mallarmé and dated January 1891 by Gauguin: “au poete Mallarmé Témoignage d’une très grande admiration. Paul Gauguin. J<sup>er</sup> 1891.” See Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 39, cat. 12.

Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), pp. 40–41, cat. 12 (ill.).

Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), pp. 40–41, cat. 12 (ill.). Sold at auction from the collection of D. David-Weill in May 1971; Estampes de maîtres des XIXe et XXe siècles, sale cat. (Hôtel Drouot, 1971), lot 110 (ill.).

Purchased from the collection of D. David-Weill at auction in May 1971; Estampes de maîtres des XIXe et XXe siècles, sale cat. (Hôtel Drouot, 1971), lot 110 (ill.).

Wolfgang Wittrock purchased it at auction in December 1982; Important Modern Prints, Christie, Manson & Woods Ltd., lot 76 (ill.), correspondence, curatorial object file, Art Institute of Chicago.

Wolfgang Wittrock invoice, Aug. 22, 1983, addressed to Dr. Martin L. Gecht, curatorial object file, Department of Prints and Drawings, Art Institute of Chicago.

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 26.1 Portrait of Stéphane Mallarmé, 1891.

fig. 26.1.1 Verso of Gauguin’s Portrait of Stéphane Mallarmé (1891). The Art Institute of Chicago, 2015.255.

</section>
